Articles.Content:
Just made a new windows 10 - 64 bit gaming machine with 16gigs of RAM and a GTX 970.

I am trying to get KSP with some mods, specifically Astronomer's Visual Pack. But it keeps crashing when I try to start the game up when KSP gets close to using 4 gigs of RAM. Turns out I am using 32 bit KSP. Saw that 1.05 is supposed to have a 64 bit .exe installed with it, but I do not have it. Have deleted and reinstalled numerous times but it still is not there.

Am I missing something? Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks

[quote name='jacksa2']Saw that 1.05 is supposed to have a 64 bit .exe installed with it...[/QUOTE]

I'm not sure where you read that, but there currently isn't an officially supported 64-bit KSP version for Windows. There are too many stability issues with the Unity engine, so the 64-bit version is on hold. It "might" be in 1.1 when that arrives.

There is a community 64-bit hack, but results widely vary.

Cheers,
-Claw

Take this and make your life easier.

[url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117224-Windows-64-bit-community-workaround[/url]

And this

[url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113069-WIN-1-0-X-KSP-x64-Total-Unfixer-v2-2-04-08-2015[/url]
